DataElement.preferredName: RT DVH ROI Volume Contribution Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Specifies whether volume within ROI is included or excluded in DVH.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Dose Volume Histogram Imaging Region of Interest Contribution
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A plot of a cumulative dose-volume frequency distribution that graphically summarizes the simulated radiation distribution within a volume of interest of a patient which would result from a proposed radiation treatment plan._A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing and open or closed polygon)._The part played by somebody or something in bringing about an end or result.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A plot of a cumulative dose-volume frequency distribution that graphically summarizes the simulated radiation distribution within a volume of interest of a patient which would result from a proposed radiation treatment plan.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

A plot of a cumulative dose-volume frequency distribution that graphically summarizes the simulated radiation distribution within a volume of interest of a patient which would result from a proposed radiation treatment plan.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing an open or closed polygon).:The part played by somebody or something in bringing about an end or result.

Concepts.definition: A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing and open or closed polygon).
The part played by somebody or something in bringing about an end or result.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  12/10/13 created for a Norton (NCI) DICOM RT study. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: CS: A string of characters with leading or trailing spaces being non-significant consisting of Upper Case, 0-9, SPACE, Underscore. [Standard-based]_A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing and open or closed polygon)._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._The part played by somebody or something in bringing about an end or result._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.

Concepts.definition: Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.

Concepts.definition: A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing and open or closed polygon).
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
The part played by somebody or something in bringing about an end or result.
A condition or state at a particular time.
